English
Biopic of J. Edgar Hoover told by Hoover as he recalls his career for a biography.
Early in his career, Hoover fixated on Communists, anarchists and any other
revolutionary taking action against the U.S. government. He slowly builds the
agency's reputation, becoming the sole arbiter of who gets hired and fired. One
of his hires is Clyde Tolson who is quickly promoted to Assistant Director and
would be Hoover's confidant and companion for the rest of Hoover's life. Hoover's
memories have him playing a greater role in the many high profile cases the FBI
was involved in - the Lindbergh baby kidnapping, the arrest of bank robbers like
John Dillinger - and also show him to be quite adept at manipulating the various
politicians he's worked with over his career, thanks in large part to his secret
files.
